Description.Description: Adaptability increases STAB of a Pokmon with this Ability from 1.5 to 2.

When a stat of a Pokmon with this Ability is lowered by an opponent, its Special Attack is increased by two stages. Competitive will not activate if the Pokmon with this Ability lowers its own stats (such as with Close Combat) or if its stats are lowered by an ally.
If multiple stats are lowered (such as by Memento or Venom Drench) Competitive activates for each stat lowered.
Competitive activates before a held White Herb. If the Pokmon no longer has any negative stat stages after Competitive is applied, the White Herb will not have the chance to activate.
Aerilate causes all Normal-type moves used by the Pokmon to become Flying-type and receive a 30% power boost. It overrides Ion Deluge and Electrify.
Affected moves now receive a 20% power boost.

When a Pokmon with this Ability faints due to damage from a move that makes contact, the attacking Pokmon takes damage equal to  of its own maximum HP. This Ability will not activate if a Pokmon with Damp is on the field.
When a Pokmon with Air Lock is in battle, all effects of weather are negated (though the weather itself does not disappear).
When a Pokmon with Air Lock is brought out, the message The effects of weather disappeared. will be displayed after the Ability is announced.

During extremely harsh sunlight, heavy rain, and strong winds, even if a Pokmon is negating the effects of weather with Air Lock, the moves Sunny Day, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, and Hail will still fail if used, and the Abilities Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream, and Snow Warning will still fail to activate. However, all other effects of these weather conditions are negated by Air Lock.
If a Pokmon with Analytic executes its move after all other Pokmon have made their move, the power of its move is increased by 30%.

In a Triple Battle, this means that if the Pokmon with Analytic is targeting a Pokmon in a flank position that chooses to switch with its ally in the middle, its move's power will always be normal when it attacks the Pokmon that is shifted into the flank position; but if the Pokmon with Analytic targets a Pokmon in the middle whose ally on a flank chooses to shift into the middle position, its move's power still depends on whether the Pokmon that was in the middle (and is now on a flank) has acted when the Pokmon with Analytic uses its move.

If another Pokmon faints before it gets a chance to make its move, Analytic's bonus depends on whether that Pokmon would have moved before the user that turn, based on its Speed and the move it chose to use.
Modifications to that Speed or to priority caused by paralysis, a held item (such as Power Weight), or an Ability (such as Stall) are taken into account.
Modifications to that Speed or to priority caused by paralysis, a held item (such as Power Weight), or an Ability (such as Stall) are not taken into account.
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a critical hit, Anger Point maximizes its Attack stat by raising it to +6 stages (regardless of its current stage).
Anger Point will activate even if the Pokmon's substitute is hit.
Anger Point does not activate if the Pokmon's substitute is hit.

Description.Description: When a Pokmon with Anticipation enters the battle or a Pokmon gains the Ability Anticipation, it causes the Pokmon to shudder if any opponent has a damaging move that is super effective against the Pokmon with Anticipation, a one-hit knockout move, or Selfdestruct or Explosion. Shuddering has no actual effect, except that the presence of the ability message is meant to provide information about possible moves the opponent might have.

Hidden Power, Judgment, Weather Ball, and Natural Gift are treated as Normal-type moves. If the opponent has Scrappy or Normalize, or if Gravity is in effect, Anticipation will take those effects into account when determining if an opponent's move is in fact super effective. Counter, Metal Burst, and Mirror Coat do not trigger Anticipation.
The moves Selfdestruct and Explosion are now treated like all other Normal-type moves and thus no longer trigger Anticipation.

Counter, Metal Burst, and Mirror Coat are counted as attacking moves of their types, so can trigger Anticipation. Techno Blast is treated as a Normal-type move. Synchronoise is treated as an ordinary Psychic-type move. Anticipation does not factor in the effects of Scrappy, Normalize, or Gravity on type matchups when determining if it should display a trigger message.

Hidden Power is now treated as its effective type rather than Normal-type. Revelation Dance and Multi-Attack are treated as Normal-type moves. Freeze-Dry is treated as an ordinary Ice-type move. Flying Press is treated as an ordinary Fighting-type move. Aura Wheel is treated as an Electric-type move.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Normal-type moves (including Self-Destruct and Explosion) can trigger Anticipation in Inverse Battles, if the Pokmon is weak to Normal-type moves when that type chart is used.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Anticipation does not factor in the effect of strong winds on type matchups, nor the effect of opponents' abilities such as Aerilate on changing the type of their moves.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Arena Trap prevents all grounded adjacent opponents from fleeing (including Teleport) or switching out as long as the user remains in battle. However, if a Pokmon with Arena Trap switches in, opponents that decided to switch out at the beginning of that turn but have not yet moved will still switch out. Arena Trap does not affect Flying-type opponents, or opponents with the ability Levitate.

Using Baton Pass, U-turn, Volt Switch, Flip Turn, or Parting Shot will still cause the Pokmon to switch out. Holding a Shed Shell allows the Pokmon to switch out, but not flee or Teleport. Having the Ability Run Away or holding a Smoke Ball allows the Pokmon to flee or Teleport, but not switch.
If a wild Pokmon has Arena Trap and the player's Pokmon faints, if the player attempts to flee instead of sending out another Pokmon, they are unaffected by Arena Trap.
Arena Trap does not affect allies.
Ghost-type Pokmon who are normally not grounded are now immune to Arena Trap.
Aroma Veil prevents the Pokmon with this Ability and its allies (including non-adjacent allies) from being afflicted by Taunt, Torment, Encore, Disable and Cursed Body, Heal Block, and infatuation.
As Ice Rider Calyrex, this Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Glastrier's Chilling Neigh Ability.
As Shadow Rider Calyrex, this Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Spectrier's Grim Neigh Ability.
Both versions of As One are functionally distinct, despite having the same name.

When a Calyrex with As One is sent into battle, the Ability causes the message <name> has two Abilities! to pop up. Any entry hazards activate after the message. Subsequent triggers that cause one of the component Abilities to pop up a message do so citing the name of the Ability as Unnerve, Chilling Neigh, or Grim Neigh as appropriate, rather than As One.

Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, and Simple Beam fail if the target has either version of As One. Role Play, Skill Swap, and Entrainment fail if either Pokmon has As One. As One cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver. As One cannot be replaced by Mummy, traded by Wandering Spirit, or suppressed by Core Enforcer or Neutralizing Gas.
As Ice Rider Calyrex, this Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Glastrier's Chilling Neigh Ability.
As Shadow Rider Calyrex, this Ability combines the effects of both Calyrex's Unnerve Ability and Spectrier's Grim Neigh Ability.
Both versions of As One are functionally distinct, despite having the same name.

When a Calyrex with As One is sent into battle, the Ability causes the message <name> has two Abilities! to pop up. Any entry hazards activate after the message. Subsequent triggers that cause one of the component Abilities to pop up a message do so citing the name of the Ability as Unnerve, Chilling Neigh, or Grim Neigh as appropriate, rather than As One.

Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, and Simple Beam fail if the target has either version of As One. Role Play, Skill Swap, and Entrainment fail if either Pokmon has As One. As One cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver. As One cannot be replaced by Mummy, traded by Wandering Spirit, or suppressed by Core Enforcer or Neutralizing Gas.

Aura Break inverts the effects of Fairy Aura and Dark Aura: instead of multiplying the power of Fairy- or Dark-type moves by those Abilities' normal multiplier of 1.33, the power of moves of that type is divided by 1.33 instead, resulting in approximately a 25% decrease in power as long as both Abilities are active.
Even if a Pokmon with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze uses a Fairy- or Dark-type move, the effect of Aura Break still applies.
At the end of each turn, each adjacent sleeping opponent takes damage equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP.

Bad Dreams inflicts damage after a Pokmon that is drowsy due to Yawn falls asleep (and thus inflicts damage to a Pokmon the same turn it falls asleep due to drowsiness). Bad Dreams applies after a Pokmon has the opportunity to be woken up by Hydration, Shed Skin, or Healer.

At any time after the first Pok Ball is thrown and fails to catch a Pokmon, at the end of a turn, if a Pokmon with Ball Fetch is on the field and not holding another item, it will pick up the same type of ball as the first one thrown. This can only occur once in a battle.
Ball Fetch does not work in Max Raid Battles.
This Ability raises the power of allies' special moves by 30%.

Battle Armor prevents the opponent from landing a critical hit, even if they would usually always land one such as with Frost Breath, Storm Throw, Wicked Blow, Surging Strikes, or with Merciless (if the target is poisoned).

When a Greninja with Battle Bond directly causes another Pokmon (including allies) to faint by using a damaging move, unless this ends the battle, it will change into Ash-Greninja. After the battle, the Pokmon reverts to its original form.

Ash-Greninja has higher base stats than regular Greninja. If Ash-Greninja uses Water Shuriken, the move's power becomes 20 (rather than the usual 15) and it always hits three times. If a Pokmon transforms into Ash-Greninja, Battle Bond does not affect the transformed Pokmon's use of Water Shuriken.

Multiple Greninja can activate this Ability during the same battle. If Ash-Greninja faints in battle, it will revert to its original form, and that Greninja cannot change into Ash-Greninja again during the same battle even after being revived.

Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, Simple Beam, and Entrainment fail if the target has Battle Bond. Role Play and Skill Swap fail if either Pokmon has Battle Bond. Battle Bond cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver. Battle Bond cannot be replaced by Mummy or suppressed by Core Enforcer. If a Pokmon other than Greninja obtains Battle Bond with Imposter or Transform, the Pokmon cannot change form into Ash-Greninja even if it knocks out another Pokmon.

When a Pokmon with Beast Boost directly causes another Pokmon (including allies) to faint by using a damaging move, its highest stat (other than HP) is increased by one stage for each Pokmon knocked out by that move execution. If this stat is already at +6 stages, Beast Boost will not activate (not even in the case of a tie of two or more stats).

For determining the highest stat, Beast Boost does not take into account stat stages, held items, or reductions due to status conditions; however, it does consider the effects of Power Split, Guard Split, Power Trick, Wonder Room, and Speed Swap. In the case of a tie between multiple stats, it increases one stat, prioritized in this order: Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed.

If the Pokmon fainting ends the battle, Beast Boost will not activate. Beast Boost activates after the Pokmon gains Attack from Fell Stinger. If a Pokmon with Beast Boost defeats a Pokmon with Mummy using a contact move, the Pokmon's Ability will become Mummy before Beast Boost has the opportunity to activate.
Every time the HP of a Pokmon with Berserk drops below half, its Special Attack is raised by one stage.

If the HP of a Pokmon with Berserk drops below half but is about to be restored to above half due to a held item such as a Sitrus Berry, Berserk will activate before the HP is restored. However, if the move that hits the Pokmon with Berserk is a multi-strike move, the item will be consumed immediately after the hit that drops the HP to below half, so Berserk will only activate if the HP is still below half after all the strikes and after the activation of the held item.

If the HP falls below half due to indirect damage, such as one caused by Leech Seed, status conditions, or weather, Berserk won't activate. Berserk will not activate if the Pokmon's HP falls below half by a move affected by Sheer Force.

Big Pecks prevents other Pokmon from lowering the Defense stat stage of the Pokmon with this Ability. It does not prevent the Pokmon with this Ability from lowering its own Defense, such as by using Shell Smash.
Effects that decrease Defense without using stat stages, such as Guard Swap, Heart Swap, or Guard Split, are unaffected by Big Pecks.
This Ability can be ignored by Pokmon with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, and Turboblaze.
When a Pokmon with Blaze uses a Fire-type move, the move's power will be increased by 50% if the user has less than or equal to  of its maximum HP remaining.

Instead of boosting Fire-type moves' power, Blaze now technically boosts the Pokmon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% during damage calculation if a Fire-type move is being used, resulting in effectively the same effect.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Pokmon with Bulletproof are not affected by ball and bomb moves.
Cheek Pouch restores 33% of the Pokmon's maximum HP when it consumes a Berry, after the effect of the Berry is applied.

Cheek Pouch activates even if the Pokmon eats another Pokmon's held Berry via Bug Bite, Pluck, or Fling, but only if the Berry is actually eaten for an effect (i.e. the Berry consumption animation plays). Consuming a Berry through other means (such as Natural Gift, using Fling, or its Trainer giving it a Berry from the Bag) will not trigger Cheek Pouch.
Cheek Pouch will not activate if the Pokmon is under the effect of Heal Block.

When a Pokmon with Chilling Neigh directly causes another Pokmon (including allies) to faint by using a damaging move, its Attack is increased by one stage. If its Attack is already at +6 stages, Chilling Neigh will not activate.
During harsh sunlight, the Speed stat of Pokmon with this Ability is doubled.

Clear Body prevents stat reduction caused by other Pokmon's moves and Abilities (such as Scary Face and Intimidate), including Sticky Web. Clear Body does not prevent self-inflicted stat reductions such as from moves like Superpower or Shell Smash.

Clear Body only protects from effects that lower stat stages, so it does not prevent stat reduction from items like the Iron Ball, the status conditions paralysis or burn, or the moves Guard Split or Power Split. Clear Body does not prevent stat stages being directly modified by Heart Swap, Guard Swap, Power Swap, Baton Pass, or Topsy-Turvy.
This Ability is ignored by moves and Abilities that ignore Abilities, such as Mold Breaker.
When a Pokmon with Cloud Nine is in battle, all effects of weather are negated (though the weather itself does not disappear).
When a Pokmon with Cloud Nine is brought out, the message The effects of weather disappeared. will be displayed.

During extremely harsh sunlight, heavy rain, and strong winds, even if a Pokmon is negating the effects of weather with Cloud Nine, the moves Sunny Day, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, and Hail will still fail if used, and the Abilities Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream, and Snow Warning will still fail to activate. However, all other effects of these weather conditions are negated by Cloud Nine.

When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a damage-dealing move (except for Struggle and Shadow moves), Color Change will change the Pokmon's own type to the type of the move that it was hit by. Color Change does not activate if the Pokmon is hit by a move of the same type as itself, even if the Pokmon is dual-typed. Color Change does not activate if the Pokmon's substitute is hit.

Even if the Pokmon with Color Change has two types, it will only have a single type after the effect is applied. If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by Weather Ball during shadowy aura, it will become Normal-type.
Color Change will activate after the first hit of a multi-strike move. Future Sight, Doom Desire and Pain Split do not activate Color Change.

Status conditions are inflicted before Color Change activates. As a result, even if Color Change would make the Pokmon become a type that is immune to the status condition, the Pokmon can still be afflicted with the status condition; for example, a Pokmon with Color Change that is hit by Poison Sting has a chance to be poisoned before it becomes Poison-type.
Color Change now activates after the last hit of a multi-strike move.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Future Sight and Doom Desire now activate Color Change when they hit (they do not activate Color Change when used).
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Color Change will not activate when the Pokmon is hit by a typeless Revelation Dance. It will also not activate if the Pokmon is affected by Forest's Curse or Trick-or-Treat and is hit by a Grass or Ghost-type move, respectively.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: The Pokmon with this Ability is treated as if it is asleep, without having the status condition. The Pokmon with this Ability can still use moves (including successfully using Sleep Talk and Snore). It cannot be afflicted with non-volatile status conditions or become drowsy due to Yawn.

The Pokmon with this Ability takes double damage from Hex and Wake-Up Slap; can be affected by Dream Eater, Nightmare, and Bad Dreams; and cannot successfully use Rest. However, due to not actually having the sleep status condition, the Pokmon with this Ability is not considered to have a status condition for the purposes of effects such as Purify and Chesto Berries.

Comatose is unaffected by effects that prevent sleep (such as Uproar, Electric Terrain and Sweet Veil). Comatose is unaffected by Mold Breaker, Turboblaze, and Teravolt. A Pokmon with Poison Touch using Sunsteel Strike cannot poison a target that has Comatose.

Role Play, Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, Simple Beam, and Entrainment fail if the target has the Ability Comatose. Skill Swap fails if either Pokmon has Comatose. Comatose cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver. Comatose cannot be replaced by Mummy or suppressed by Core Enforcer. If a Pokmon that has its Ability suppressed passes that effect to a Pokmon with Comatose via Baton Pass, that effect fades. If a Pokmon that already has its Ability suppressed obtains Comatose with Transform, Comatose's effects are suppressed (i.e. the Pokmon will not be protected from status conditions, is not treated as asleep for effects such as Sleep Talk, etc.).

If a Pokmon that already has a status condition gains Comatose (i.e. due to Transform or Imposter), it will not be cured of its status condition. If the Pokmon was asleep, the status has its normal effect, unaffected by Comatose.

Compound Eyes increases the accuracy of moves used by the Pokmon with this Ability by multiplying the original accuracy by a factor of 1.3. This means that Thunder, for example, has 91% accuracy as opposed to the usual 70% (70 x 1.3 = 91%). A move with a theoretical accuracy of 77% or higher will have its accuracy set to 100% (77% x 1.3 = 100.1%).

This Ability inverts all changes to the stat stages of a Pokmon with this Ability; if an effect would lower a stat, it is increased instead, and if an effect would increase a stat, it is decreased instead. Effects that change a Pokmon's stats without affecting stat stages, such as burn and paralysis, are not affected by Contrary.

This also applies to self-inflicted changes, such as Curse and Leaf Storm. This Ability only inverts the changes when they are applied; it does not passively cause all existing changes to reverse; therefore, if the Ability Contrary is no longer in effect or the stats are passed by Baton Pass, all existing stat stage changes remain the same. Stats passed by Baton Pass onto a Pokmon with Contrary are not reversed.
Stat stage increases caused by the Z-Power effects of status Z-Moves are not inverted by Contrary. However, the stat stage increases as a result of Extreme Evoboost are inverted.

Mist (including from Guard Spec.) and Flower Veil take into account Contrary's inversion before determining whether to block the stat change. For example, if a Pokmon with Contrary is targeted by String Shot while protected by Mist, it will gain Speed; if a Pokmon with Contrary is targeted by Swagger while protected by Mist, its Attack will not be changed.

If a Pokmon with Contrary uses Belly Drum, its Attack will be lowered to -6 stages (although the message will still say that the user maximized its Attack); if the user's Attack is already at -6 stages, Belly Drum will still deduct HP. Even if the user has Contrary, Belly Drum fails if the user's Attack is already at +6.
If a move used by a Pokmon with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze would change a stat stage of a Pokmon with Contrary, the change will not be inverted.
If a Pokmon with Contrary is affected by Strength Sap, even if its Attack stat is at +6 stages, Strength Sap will restore the user's HP.

If a Pokmon with Contrary is hit with a Max Move that would lower stats, or uses a Max Move that would raise stats, the change will be inverted, but the message describing the stat change will not be displayed.

Corrosion allows the user to inflict poison on any Pokmon regardless of type, allowing them to poison Poison and Steel-type Pokmon. However, the user cannot conventionally poison the target with a physical move or a special move, and can only be conventionally done with a status move that inflicts poison.

If a Poison- or Steel-type Pokmon with Corrosion holds a Toxic Orb, it will badly poison itself. A Pokmon with Corrosion can poison Poison-type and Steel-type Pokmon if it uses Fling while holding a Toxic Orb or a Poison Barb.

This Ability has no effect on Toxic Spikes. It does not allow the Pokmon with this Ability to poison a Pokmon with Immunity. Corrosion does not allow the Pokmon with this Ability to damage Steel-type Pokmon with Poison-type moves.

If the Pokmon with this Ability uses a move, and that move gets reflected by the target due to Magic Coat or Magic Bounce, the reflected move will not be able to poison Steel- or Poison-type Pokmon. If a Poison- or Steel-type Pokmon with this Ability poisons a target with Synchronize, Synchronize will not be able to affect the Pokmon with this Ability.
If the Pokmon with this Ability uses Magic Coat to reflect a status move that inflicts poison, the reflected move will be able to poison Steel- or Poison-type Pokmon.
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a damaging move, the Speed of all other Pokmon is decreased by one stage.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move (such as Fury Swipes), each hit activates this Ability.
When a Pokmon with this Ability enters the battle, stat stages of ally Pokmon are reset to 0.

When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a damaging move, there is a 30% chance that the Cursed Body will disable that move of the attacking Pokmon for 4 turns (including the turn Cursed Body activates). Cursed Body can activate even if the attacker is behind a substitute or if the Pokmon with Cursed Body is knocked out, but will not activate if the attack hits the substitute of the Pokmon with Cursed Body.

If Cursed Body disables a multi-strike move before it has finished all of its hits, it will not prevent the other hits from being executed. Cursed Body can disable a move that calls another move if the called move dealt damage.

If a Pokmon uses a damaging Z-Move on a Pokmon with Cursed Body, that damaging Z-Move can be disabled (with no effect on the base move), despite Z-Moves only being able to be used once per battle. However, if Cursed Body would disable a status Z-Move (such as Z-Nature Power), the base status move will be disabled.

When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact from a Pokmon of the opposite gender, there is a 30% chance that the attacking Pokmon will become infatuated. If either Pokmon is a gender-unknown Pokmon (such as Magnemite), this Ability will not activate.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move that makes contact (such as Fury Swipes), each hit has an independent chance to activate this Ability.

Damp prevents all Pokmon from using Self-Destruct, Explosion, Mind Blown, and Misty Explosion; if a Pokmon attempts to use one of these moves, it will fail and the user will not faint or take damage. Additionally, Damp prevents the Ability Aftermath from doing damage when the Pokmon with Aftermath faints.
Damp affects non-adjacent Pokmon in Triple Battles.
Despite the attacks involving explosions, Damp does not prevent the activation of Powder or Shell Trap.

Whenever another Pokmon uses a dance move, a Pokmon with the Ability Dancer will immediately use that move as well. Using a move through Dancer is a separate action to using the move originally selected. Dancer will not activate for a move copied by another Pokmon with Dancer, but it will activate on an instructed dance move.

Dancer is able to copy a status dance move that has been powered up into its corresponding Z-Move (e.g. Z-Feather Dance), but the Pokmon with Dancer copies the regular version of the move and does not gain the additional Z-Power effect.

Dancer will not activate if the move's animation does not play (assuming battle animations are on): if all of the move's targets are protected from it, the move fails to affect any Pokmon (e.g. Teeter Dance if all of the targets are already confused or have Own Tempo), or all targets are immune (e.g. Electric-type Revelation Dance if the target is Ground-type). Dancer will not activate if the move is stolen by Snatch or if the Pokmon with Dancer is in the semi-invulnerable turn of a move like Fly.
If multiple Pokmon have Dancer when a dance move is used, the slowest Pokmon will move first (Lagging Tail and Full Incense are ignored), even during Trick Room.

If the Pokmon with Dancer is confused, it may hurt itself instead of copying the move, even if it is protected by a move like Protect or Mat Block. If a Pokmon has flinched, this also applies to moves it subsequently tries to copy with Dancer. A Pokmon with Dancer that is locked into a consecutively executed move (such as Petal Dance) or any move by Encore or a held Choice item will still try to copy the move, but will fail unless it is locked into that same dance move; if a Pokmon uses Petal Dance via Dancer while locked into Petal Dance, this usage does not count towards the 2-3 turn duration. If a Pokmon with Dancer is holding an Assault Vest, it can still successfully copy status dance moves.

Lunar Dance is copied after the original user faints. If a Pokmon copies Petal Dance via Dancer, it will not be locked into the move. If Feather Dance is reflected by Magic Bounce or Magic Coat, Dancer will not activate for either the initial usage of the move or its reflected use. If the Pokmon with Dancer is under the effect of Taunt, it will still try to copy a status dance move, but will fail.

Moves used via Dancer can be stolen by Snatch and reflected by Magic Bounce and Magic Coat. Moves used via Dancer are not considered the move used most recently (such as for the purpose of Instruct, Mimic or Mirror Move), but damage dealt by them is considered for the purpose of Mirror Coat and Metal Burst.

In a Double Battle, if an ally uses a single-target dance move on an opponent, then the copied move will target the same opponent when copied by Dancer. Otherwise, a copied single-target dance move will target the user of the dance move.

Dark Aura increases the damage dealt by Dark-type attacks by 33% for all Pokmon on the field. This effect is inverted by Aura Break, instead dividing the power of Dark-type attacks by 1.33, resulting in approximately a 25% reduction in damage.
The effects will not stack multiple times if more than one Pokmon has this Ability.
Dauntless Shield raises the Defense stat of the Pokmon with this Ability by one stage when it enters the battle.

If an opponent uses a priority move (including moves boosted by Prankster, Gale Wings, or Triage) that targets the Pokmon with Dazzling or its allies, Dazzling prevents the Pokmon from executing that move (PP is still consumed). When this occurs, the text [Pokmon] cannot use [Move]! is displayed.

Moves that target all Pokmon (except Perish Song, Flower Shield, and Rototiller) and moves that target all foes cannot be blocked by Dazzling even if they become priority moves. Dazzling has no effect on allies' priority moves.

Priority status Z-Moves will have their Z-Power effect activate. For example, if a Pokmon uses Z-Baby-Doll Eyes on a Pokmon under the effect of Dazzling, the user will still gain Defense, but it will not lower the target's Attack.
Mold Breaker will ignore this Ability.
Defeatist halves the user's Attack and Special Attack stats when their HP is equal to or less than half of its maximum.

When a stat of a Pokmon with this Ability is lowered by an opponent, its Attack is increased by two stages. Defiant will not activate if the Pokmon with this Ability lowers its own stats (such as with Close Combat) or if its stats are lowered by an ally.
If multiple stats are lowered (such as by Memento or Venom Drench), Defiant activates for each stat lowered.
Defiant activates before a held White Herb. If the Pokmon no longer has any negative stat stages after Defiant is applied, the White Herb will not have the chance to activate.

When a Pokmon with Delta Stream enters the battle or a Pokmon gains the Ability, a unique weather condition called strong winds is created. In a Rotation Battle, Delta Stream will not activate if the Pokmon is sent out in a rotated-out position, nor will it activate when that Pokmon is rotated in. In addition, Delta Stream will not activate if strong winds are already present on the battlefield or if the Pokmon's Ability is suppressed prior to it gaining Delta Stream.

Strong winds cause moves that would be super effective against pure Flying-type Pokmon to instead deal neutral damage to all Flying-type Pokmon (unless a Pokmon on the field has Cloud Nine or Air Lock). Outside of Inverse Battles, this causes Electric-, Ice-, and Rock-type moves to deal neutral damage to Flying-type Pokmon; during Inverse Battles, this causes Bug-, Fighting-, Grass-, and Ground-type moves to deal neutral damage to Flying-type Pokmon. If a move is not super effective against the Pokmon's other type (for dual-typed Pokmon), this no longer counts as a super-effective hit (for the purposes of damage-reducing Berries, etc.). Strong winds have no effect on Stealth Rock or Anticipation.

Additionally, strong winds cause the weather-modifying moves Sunny Day, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, and Hail to fail if used, and cause the Abilities Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream, and Snow Warning to fail to activate. However, the strong winds can be replaced by Desolate Land or Primordial Sea.

Once strong winds are in effect, as long as there is an active Pokmon on the field with Delta Stream (even if it is not the Pokmon who created it), the strong winds will remain in effect, unless Delta Stream is suppressed or replaced. If the only Pokmon on the field with Delta Stream is rotated out or switched out, or has its Ability suppressed or replaced, the strong winds will dissipate.

When a Pokmon with Desolate Land enters the battle or a Pokmon gains the Ability Desolate Land, the Ability creates extremely harsh sunlight, a unique variation of harsh sunlight. In a Rotation Battle, Desolate Land will not activate if the Pokmon is sent out in a rotated-out position, nor will it activate if the Pokmon is rotated in. In addition, Desolate Land will not activate if extremely harsh sunlight is already present on the battlefield.

Along with the usual effects of harsh sunlight, extremely harsh sunlight causes damage-dealing Water-type moves to fail (unless a Pokmon on the field has the Air Lock or Cloud Nine Ability). Additionally, extremely harsh sunlight causes the weather-modifying moves Sunny Day, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, and Hail to fail if used; and causes the Abilities Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream, and Snow Warning to fail to activate.

Once in effect, as long as there is a Pokmon on the field with the Ability Desolate Land active (even if it is not the Pokmon who created it), the harsh sunlight will remain in effect unless it is replaced. (If the only Pokmon on the field with Desolate Land is rotated out or switched out, or has its Ability suppressed or replaced, the harsh sunlight will dissipate.) The harsh sunlight can be replaced by Primordial Sea or Delta Stream.

If a Mimikyu in its Disguised Form is hit by a damaging attack or hits itself in confusion, Disguise prevents the move from calling the damage formula. The move will thus deal no damage, and type effectiveness will not be calculated (except in case of immunity, which prevents Disguise from triggering since the move will not hit in the first place). When this effect activates, the message, Its disguise served it as a decoy! is displayed, Mimikyu changes to its Busted Form, and finally the message, <Name>'s disguise was busted! is displayed. If Mimikyu's type had been changed beforehand, it is restored to Ghost/Fairy when it changes to its Busted Form.

Mimikyu remains in Busted Form if it is switched out, but reverts to Disguised Form outside of battle. If a Mimikyu faints and is revived, it will be revived in its Disguised Form and Disguise will be able to activate again.

Disguise will not protect against entry hazards or weather damage. Disguise activates at the first strike of a multi-strike move such as Water Shuriken and will not block damage from remaining strikes. Disguise only blocks the damage from moves; additional effects of damaging moves like paralysis from Nuzzle are not prevented. If Mimikyu has a substitute, the substitute will take damage before Disguise.

Because a Disguise-busting hit skips the type effectiveness check as well as the rest of the damage formula, Weakness Policy will not activate regardless of the move's type. A held Air Balloon will be popped even if Disguise negates the damage. Busting a Disguise with Rollout or Ice Ball results in the Rollout storage glitch.

Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, and Simple Beam fail if the target has the Ability Disguise. Role Play, Skill Swap, and Entrainment fail if either Pokmon has Disguise. Disguise cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver. Disguise cannot be replaced by Mummy or suppressed by Core Enforcer; if a Pokmon that has its Ability suppressed passes that effect to a Pokmon with this Ability via Baton Pass, that effect fades. If a Pokmon obtains Disguise with Imposter or Transform, the Ability will never activate.

Pokmon with Mold Breaker, Teravolt or Turboblaze will ignore Disguise, hitting through the disguise without busting it. The same is true for the moves Moongeist Beam, Sunsteel Strike, and Photon Geyser as well as the Z-Moves Searing Sunraze Smash, Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom, and Light That Burns the Sky.

When a Disguised Form Mimikyu's Disguise is busted, upon changing to its Busted Form it now loses HP equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and not factoring in any increase in maximum HP due to Dynamax. The moves G-Max Drum Solo, G-Max Fireball, and G-Max Hydrosnipe will ignore Disguise.

Download raises either the Attack stat or Special Attack stat by one stage depending on the foe's lowest current defensive stat: it will raise Attack if the foe's current Defense is lower than its current Special Defense stat, otherwise it will raise Special Attack.

For determining which of the foe's defensive stat is lower, Download takes into account stat stages and the effect of Power Trick; however, it does not consider the effects of held items, Abilities such as Marvel Scale, or Wonder Room. In case of a tie between the foe's Defense and Special Defense, Download increases Special Attack.
During a Double or Triple Battle, Download will calculate the average Defense and Special Defense by adding the stats of all opposing Pokmon, and determine the lowest stat between both averages.
Dragon's Maw boosts the power of user's Dragon-type moves by 50%.

Drizzle summons rain in battle as soon as a Pokmon with Drizzle enters the battle. Its effects are the same as the move Rain Dance, but instead of lasting for a limited amount of turns, it lasts for the whole battle (unless it is replaced by another type of weather). If a Pokmon with Drizzle is sent out in the same turn as another Pokmon whose Ability affects the weather, the slower Pokmon's Ability will override the faster Pokmon's Ability.
The rain now lasts only for five turns. This can be extended to eight turns if the Pokmon is holding a Damp Rock.
Rain called by Drizzle does not allow Sliggoo to evolve into Goodra.

Drizzle will not activate if the Pokmon it's on is a Kyogre that's in position to undergo Primal Reversion; in that case the Primal Reversion will happen instead, its ability will be replaced by Primordial Sea, and only that ability will activate. Drizzle will also fail to activate if heavy rain, extremely harsh sunlight, or strong winds are already in effect.

Drought summons harsh sunlight in battle as soon as a Pokmon with Drought enters the battle. Its effects are the same as the move Sunny Day, but instead of lasting for a limited amount of turns, it lasts for the whole battle (unless it is replaced by another weather condition). If a Pokmon with Drought is sent out in the same turn as another Pokmon whose Ability affects the weather, the slower Pokmon's Ability will override the faster Pokmon's Ability.
The sunlight now lasts only for five turns. This can be extended to eight turns if the Pokmon is holding a Heat Rock.

Drought will not activate if the Pokmon it's on is a Groudon that's in position to undergo Primal Reversion; in that case the Primal Reversion will happen instead, its ability will be replaced by Desolate Land, and only that ability will activate. Drought will also fail to activate if heavy rain, extremely harsh sunlight, or strong winds are already in effect.
During harsh sunlight, a Pokmon with Dry Skin will lose  of its maximum HP at the end of each turn. During rain, a Pokmon with Dry Skin will regain  of its maximum HP at the end of each turn.
Fire-type attacks do 25% more damage to a Pokmon with Dry Skin.

When a Pokmon with Dry Skin is hit by a Water-type move, its HP is restored by one quarter of its maximum HP, and the move will have no effect on that Pokmon (if a Pokmon with this Ability already has full HP, the Water-type move will do nothing). This effect will not activate if the Pokmon is protected from the Water-type move. Multi-strike moves, such as Water Shuriken, will only activate this effect once.
If a Pokmon with Dry Skin is holding an Absorb Bulb or Luminous Moss, Dry Skin absorbs the Water-type move so the item's effect is not triggered.

Early Bird causes quick awakening from sleep. In the turn the Pokmon is put to sleep, the number of turns it will remain asleep is preset. If it is 6 turns, it will be halved to 3. If 3, it will be rounded to 1. If only 1 turn is preset, it is rounded to 0, causing the Pokmon to instantly wake up at the end of the same turn. This also applies to the self-induced sleep from Rest, reducing its length from 2 turns to 1 turn asleep (not counting the turn in which Rest is used).
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 10% chance that the attacking Pokmon will become either poisoned, paralyzed, or asleep, with a 3.3% probability each.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move that makes contact (such as Fury Swipes), each hit has an independent chance to activate this Ability.

If a Pokmon is immune to some of the status conditions, then the chance of inflicting each of the remaining conditions is constant, so the total chance of successfully inflicting a condition decreases.
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance that the attacking Pokmon will become either poisoned, paralyzed, or asleep, with a 10% probability each.[1]
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 9% chance of poison, 10% chance of paralysis, and 11% chance of sleep.[2]
Grass-type Pokmon, Pokmon with Overcoat, and Pokmon holding Safety Goggles are now immune to Effect Spore.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: When a Pokmon with Electric Surge enters the battle, it creates the effect of the move Electric Terrain on the battlefield.

When a Pokmon with Emergency Exit drops below half of its full HP in battle, it will flee in wild battles, or switch out in Trainer battles. It can only activate when a Pokmon's HP falls from above half to below half; if it does not activate at that time, it will not activate at all (unless the Pokmon with this Ability restores HP).
Emergency Exit will not activate in trainer battles if the Pokmon is a trainer's only Pokmon left.

Emergency Exit will not activate if the Pokmon's HP falls below half due to hurting itself in confusion, Pain Split, or using Substitute or Belly Drum or Curse, but it will activate if the HP falls below half from all other damage (including Struggle recoil). If the Pokmon falls below half HP and immediately consumes a Sitrus Berry or other Berry to rise above half, Emergency Exit does not activate, but if it falls below half and recovers back above half from a Shell Bell, Emergency Exit will activate even after the Shell Bell recovery, and cause the Pokmon to retreat.
Emergency Exit will not activate if the Pokmon's HP falls below half by a move affected by Sheer Force.

It will activate only after the last hit of multi-strike moves, even if the HP of the Pokmon with this Ability drops below half before the last hit. If this Ability activates due to being hit by U-turn or Volt Switch, the user of that move will not be switched out. This Ability will not activate if the Pokmon's HP falls below half while it is in the air during the semi-invulnerable turn of Sky Drop.
Trapping moves do not prevent Emergency Exit from activating.
If the Pokmon with Emergency Exit holds a Red Card or Eject Button, the item activates first. Dragon Tail and Circle Throw switch out Pokmon before the Ability activates.
Emergency Exit will not activate on the player's Pokmon in wild battles during trials.

Fairy Aura increases the damage dealt by Fairy-type attacks by 33% for all Pokmon on the field. This effect is inverted by Aura Break, instead dividing the power of Fairy-type attacks by 1.33, resulting in approximately a 25% reduction in damage.
The effects will not stack multiple times if more than one Pokmon has this Ability.
Filter reduces damage from supereffective moves by 25%, regardless of the effectiveness multiplier.
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance that the attacking Pokmon will become burned.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move that makes contact (such as Fury Swipes), each hit has an independent chance to activate this Ability.
While the Pokmon with this Ability is burned, the power of its special moves is increased by 50%.

Flash Fire makes the Pokmon immune to Fire-type moves and will activate when hit by one. When activated, the power of the Pokmon's Fire-type moves is increased by 50%. While subsequent hits by Fire-type moves will not provide further increases in power, the Pokmon remains immune to the moves.
Flash Fire will not activate if the Pokmon is protected from the Fire-type move.
Flash Fire will not work while the user is frozen.

Instead of boosting Fire-type moves' power, Flash Fire now technically boosts the Pokmon's Attack or Special Attack by 50% during damage calculation if a Fire-type move is being used, resulting in effectively the same effect.
Flash Fire can be activated by Will-O-Wisp.
Flash Fire is now functional even if the user is frozen.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: During harsh sunlight, Flower Gift increases the Attack and Special Defense stats of the Pokmon with this Ability and its allies by 1.5.
Flower Gift is not responsible for changing Cherrim from Overcast Form into Sunshine Form.
Flower Gift can be copied by Trace or Role Play.

Along with its previous effect, Flower Gift now changes Cherrim from Overcast Form to Sunshine Form during harsh sunlight. If Cherrim loses Flower Gift or Flower Gift is suppressed (such as by Gastro Acid), it will revert to its Overcast Form, unless it was Dynamaxed at the time; if a Dynamaxed Sunshine Form Cherrim loses Flower Gift, it will remain in Sunshine Form even after it ceases to be Dynamaxed.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Role Play fails if the target has the Ability Flower Gift. Entrainment fails if the user has the Ability Flower Gift. Flower Gift cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Flower Veil prevents the Pokmon with this Ability (if it is Grass-type) and its Grass-type allies (including non-adjacent allies) from having their stats lowered by other Pokmon. Self-inflicted stat reductions, such as from Leaf Storm or Weak Armor, are not prevented. If a Grass-type Pokmon has Contrary, Flower Veil prevents the Pokmon's stats from being lowered after accounting for Contrary.

Flower Veil also prevents the Pokmon with this Ability (if it is Grass-type) and its Grass-type allies (including non-adjacent allies) from being afflicted by non-volatile status conditions or Yawn. However, it will not prevent a Pokmon from falling asleep if it is already drowsy from Yawn. This Ability has no effect on Rest, the Flame Orb, or the Toxic Orb.

A Pokmon with Fluffy takes half damage from moves that make contact. It also takes double damage from Fire-type moves. Fire-type moves that make contact will deal regular damage. Moves affected by Long Reach which make contact will deal regular damage.
Depending on the weather, Forecast will change Castform's form, which also changes its type. Castform changes as follows:
During harsh sunlight or extremely harsh sunlight, it will become Sunny Form, which is Fire-type.
During hail, it will become Snowy Form, which is Ice-type.
During rain or heavy rain, it will become Rainy Form, which is Water-type.
During a sandstorm, fog, strong winds, a shadowy aura, or clear weather it will revert to its normal form, which is Normal-type.
It will also revert to its normal form if a Pokmon on the field has Cloud Nine or Air Lock.
This Ability has no effect on Pokmon other than Castform.
Forecast does not change Castform's form until after Stealth Rock deals damage.
If a Pokmon transforms into Castform with Forecast, it will change forms with the weather just like Castform.

If Castform or a Pokmon transformed into Castform loses Forecast, it will be stuck in its current form. When it regains Forecast, it will change to the form matching the current weather, even if it is already in the correct form (which resets its type if it had changed due to an effect like Color Change).
Forecast can be copied by Role Play and Trace.
If Forecast is suppressed with Gastro Acid, it will be stuck in its current form.
Forecast cannot be copied by Trace.
If a Pokmon transforms into Castform, the Pokmon will remain in the same form as the target Castform, regardless of the weather.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: If Castform loses Forecast or Forecast is suppressed with Gastro Acid, it will revert to its normal form and not be able to change form. If Castform regains Forecast, it will change form to match the current weather, unless it would be in its normal form in the current weather.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Role Play fails if the target has the Ability Forecast. Entrainment fails if the user has the Ability Forecast. Forecast cannot be copied by Power of Alchemy or Receiver.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Forewarn shows the opponent's move with the highest power. If two or more moves are of the same power, one will be chosen at random.

In battles with multiple opponents, Forewarn will only show the highest power move out of all the moves known by the opponents. If multiple opponents have a move with the same power, one will be chosen at random. Forewarn can reveal a move of a non-adjacent opponent even if the move wouldn't be able to hit the Pokmon with Forewarn due to being out of range.
Damaging moves without a power (i.e. moves that deal direct damage and moves that have variable power) are assigned one.
If the opposing Pokmon only have status moves, it will still assign one of them.
Friend Guard reduces the damage received by allies (from both opponents and other allies) by 25%. It does not reduce the damage dealt by moves that deal direct damage.

Frisk allows the Pokmon to see the opponent's held item upon entering battle. If the foe is holding an item, a message identifying the item will be shown right after the Pokmon with Frisk enters the battle. If the foe is not holding an item, no message will appear.
In a Double or Triple Battle, an unidentified opponent is randomly chosen and their held item revealed. The item revealed may be from a non-adjacent opponent.
Frisk now identifies the held items of all opposing Pokmon, regardless of position, in the order of left to right from that team's perspective.

Full Metal Body prevents stat reduction caused by other Pokmon's moves and Abilities (such as Scary Face and Intimidate), including Sticky Web. Full Metal Body does not prevent self-inflicted stat reductions such as from moves like Superpower or Shell Smash.

Full Metal Body only protects from effects that lower stat stages, so it does not prevent stat reduction from items like the Iron Ball, the status conditions paralysis or burn, or the moves Guard Split or Power Split. Full Metal Body does not prevent stat stages being directly modified by Haze, Clear Smog, Heart Swap, Guard Swap, Power Swap, Baton Pass, or Topsy-Turvy.
Unlike White Smoke and Clear Body, this Ability cannot be ignored by moves or Abilities.
Fur Coat doubles the Defense stat of the Pokmon with this Ability.
Gale Wings increases the priority of Flying-type moves by one. Affected Flying-type attacks and offensive status moves can be blocked by Quick Guard.
This Ability does not increase the priority of Flying-type Hidden Power, Natural Gift, or Judgment, as they are treated as Normal-type moves before being used.
Gale Wings now works only if the user has full HP.
Description.Game: Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Galvanize causes all Normal-type moves used by the Pokmon to become Electric-type and receive a 20% power boost. Normal type moves that become Electric type in this manner can activate Lightning Rod, Volt Absorb, and Motor Drive.
If a move is affected by Galvanize and is used under Electric Terrain, it will receive a 50% power boost from Electric Terrain.

If Max Strike is selected with Galvanize, it'll turn into Max Lightning when used. If a move is affected by Galvanize and is used under Electric Terrain, it will receive a 30% power boost from Electric Terrain.

Gluttony causes the Pokmon to eat Berries that would normally be eaten at 25% HP or lower at 50% HP or lower instead. It has no effect on Berries that activate at other HP thresholds (such as the Oran Berry, which is normally eaten at 50% HP or less) or Berries with non-HP-related trigger conditions (such as the Leppa Berry and Lum Berry).
When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, the Speed of the attacking Pokmon is decreased by one stage.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move that makes contact (such as Fury Swipes), each hit activates this Ability.

Gorilla Tactics boosts the Pokmon's Attack by 50%, but limits the Pokmon to using only one move, similar to the Choice Band. This effect stacks with Choice items, meaning a Pokmon with this Ability and a Choice Band will have its Attack boosted to 225%.
Gorilla Tactics temporarily stops working if the user is Dynamaxed.
While Grassy Terrain is active, the Defense of the Pokmon with this Ability is increased by 50%.
When a Pokmon with Grassy Surge enters the battle, it creates the effect of the move Grassy Terrain on the battlefield.

When a Pokmon with Grim Neigh directly causes another Pokmon (including allies) to faint by using a damaging move, its Special Attack is increased by one stage. If its Special Attack is already at +6 stages, Grim Neigh will not activate.
After Cramorant uses Surf or Dive, Cramorant catches prey and changes its form depending on its remaining HP.

If its HP is over half, it catches an Arrokuda and changes into its Gulping Form. If its HP is under half, it instead catches a Pikachu and changes into its Gorging Form. If hit by an attack in either form, Cramorant spits out its catch at the attacker, dealing damage equal to  of the attacker's maximum HP and inflicting a secondary effect depending on its catch: Arrokuda lowers the attacker's Defense by one stage, while Pikachu paralyzes them.
If the attacker has Magic Guard, it will take no damage, but still trigger the cutscene and take the Defense drop or paralysis.

If Cramorant Dynamaxes while it has a catch in its mouth, it reverts to its base form (without spitting its catch). Even if a Dynamaxed Cramorant uses Surf or Dive (only possible as a wild Pokmon in a Max Raid Battle), it will not change into its Gulping or Gorging Form.
Gastro Acid, Worry Seed, and Simple Beam fail if the target has Gulp Missile. Role Play, Skill Swap, and Entrainment fail if either Pokmon has Gulp Missile. Gulp Missile cannot be copied by Trace.
While a Pokmon with this Ability has a status condition, its Attack is increased by 50%. Additionally, a Pokmon with this Ability does not lose Attack due to burn.
The Attack boost from Guts is activated if a Pokmon is frozen and uses a move which thaws it out, such as Flame Wheel or Flare Blitz.
The Attack boost from Guts does not activate if a Pokmon is frozen and uses a move which thaws it out, such as Flame Wheel or Flare Blitz.

If the Pokmon has used a Berry, there is a 50% chance of it being restored at the end of each turn. The held Berry is remembered even if it is not restored or if the Pokmon has switched out. Harvest will always activate in harsh sunlight.

Harvest can recover Berries consumed by Fling and Natural Gift; however, Harvest cannot recover Berries transferred to another Pokmon, Berries destroyed by Incinerate, Berries knocked off with Knock Off, or Berries eaten with Bug Bite or Pluck. Harvest cannot restore a Berry if it is collected by a Pokmon with Pickup. If more than one Pokmon has Pickup or Harvest, the faster Pokmon will restore an item first.
A single Pokmon's Harvest will not activate more than once per turn. If the held Berry is consumed immediately after it is restored, Harvest will not be able to restore it again until the next turn.

Harvest can recover Berries consumed that were originally another Pokmon's, but transferred to the Pokmon with Harvest. However, a Pokmon may only have one consumed item (including non-Berries) at a time; if a Pokmon consumes a Berry, obtains another item and consumes it, the original consumed Berry cannot be restored, even if the second item is restored and swapped away. If the Pokmon with Harvest obtains an item after consuming a Berry, Harvest can still restore the old Berry as long as the Pokmon has no held item and did not consume any other items (including non-Berries) since consuming the old Berry.

At the end of each turn, Healer has a 30% chance of curing an adjacent ally's status condition. If the Pokmon has multiple adjacent allies with status conditions, it has an independent 30% chance of curing each one, and can cure more than one in the same turn. If it cures a status condition, it does so before burn or poison damage is dealt on that turn.
Heatproof halves the damage done by Fire-type attacks and the burn status ailment.
Doubles the weight of the Pokmon with this Ability.
Autotomize is applied before other weight-modifying effects, including Heavy Metal. Heavy Metal is the only effect that can cause a Pokmon's weight to exceed 999.9 kg.
This has no effect on the Heavy Ball, which uses the Pokmon's species' weight rather than its current weight.
Huge Power doubles the Attack stat of the Pokmon with this Ability.
Because it is an Attack modifier and not a stat stage change, it will double the user's effective Attack stat when using Foul Play or Body Press.

At the end of each turn, Hunger Switch switches a Morpeko with the Ability between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode. In Full Belly Mode, Aura Wheel is an Electric-type move; in Hangry Mode, it is a Dark-type move.
If Morpeko's Hunger Switch is negated or replaced, Morpeko remains in its current mode.
Hustle increases the user's Attack stat by 50%, but lowers the accuracy of the user's physical moves by 20%. Special moves and status moves are unaffected by Hustle.

At the end of each turn, if it is raining, Hydration will cure the Pokmon of any non-volatile status condition. If it cures a status condition, it does so before burn or poison damage is dealt on that turn. Pokmon who are made drowsy by Yawn will not fall asleep until after Hydration takes effect, and as such, will not be healed until the end of the next turn.

Hyper Cutter prevents other Pokmon from lowering the Attack stat stage of the Pokmon with this Ability. It does not prevent the Pokmon with this Ability from lowering its own Attack, such as by using Superpower.
Effects that decrease Attack without using stat stages, such as Power Swap, Heart Swap, and Power Split, are unaffected by Hyper Cutter.
This Ability can be ignored with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, and Turboblaze.
During hail, a Pokmon with Ice Body will regain 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn. A Pokmon with this Ability will take no damage from hail if it otherwise would.

When an Eiscue that's in its Ice Face form is hit by a physical move, it takes no damage and changes into its Noice Face form. If a hailstorm is set up after Eiscue has changed into its Noice Face form, it will be restored to its Ice Face form at the end of the turn.

Ice Face does not protect against special moves. A Noice Face Eiscue can be restored to its Ice Face form once per hailstorm, and will not be restored if the hailstorm has been set up before it changed into its Noice Face form.
This form change persists even when Eiscue is switched out, but resets at the end of the battle.

Ice Scales halves damage from special moves that hit Pokmon with this Ability, including from special moves that use the target's Defense stat (like Psyshock). It has no effect on moves that deal direct damage.
When a Trainer's Pokmon with Illusion enters battle, Illusion changes the appearance of the Pokmon to that of the last conscious, non-Egg Pokmon in its Trainer's party.

Illusion replicates the appearance (including species, form, and Shininess), nickname (or species name if none), Pok Ball, and gender of the Pokmon it is masquerading as; however, it does not replicate the level of the masqueraded Pokmon. The effect is only aestheticeffects such as Attract still use the Pokmon's actual gender. On the user interface, an opponent's Pokmon disguised by Illusion will appear to be the type of the Pokmon it is disguised as (even if it is affected by a move such as Soak).

The illusion disappears when the Pokmon takes damage from a damaging move. Indirect damage (such as from a Life Orb, weather, status conditions, recoil, etc.) will not break the illusion. If the Pokmon with Illusion is hit by a multi-strike move, the illusion will be broken after the first hit. If a Pokmon with Illusion uses a Z-Move, the illusion wears off immediately before using the Z-Move.

Role Play fails if the target has the Ability Illusion. Skill Swap fails if either Pokmon has Illusion. Illusion cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy or Receiver. If a Pokmon obtains this Ability with Imposter or Transform, it will not disguise itself. Pokmon cannot transform into a Pokmon that is disguised by Illusion.
Additionally, wild Pokmon can disguise themselves with Illusion under certain circumstances.
In the special event encounter with a wild Zoroark in Lostlorn Forest, the wild Zoroark will be disguised as Entei, Raikou, or Suicune (depending on the Pokmon that triggered the event).
If a wild Pokmon with Illusion successfully calls an ally for help in an SOS Battle, it will disguise itself as the summoned ally.
If Illusion would disguise the Pokmon as another Pokmon of the same species, it fails to disguise the Pokmon at all.
Illusion can now disguise itself as another Pokmon with Illusion of the same species.

If the Pokmon Dynamaxes while disguised as a Pokmon with the Gigantamax Factor, it will Dynamax into the standard form of the Pokmon - not the Gigantamax form. If disguised as Zacian, Zamazenta, or Eternatus, the Pokmon will not be able to Dynamax.
Immunity prevents the Pokmon from being afflicted by poison.

A Pokmon with this Ability will be cured of poison if it is poisoned while in battle (such as if it gains the Ability outside of battle or by an effect like Skill Swap, or is poisoned by a Pokmon with an Ability like Mold Breaker).

If a poisoned Pokmon with Immunity is sent into battle as one of the lead Pokmon or to replace a fainted Pokmon, or gains Immunity due to Trace, it will not be cured of poison until after a Pokmon takes its turn (uses a move, switches out, etc.). It will be cured of poison if it is switched in to replace a switched out Pokmon (including if switched in via Baton Pass).
If a poisoned Pokmon has Immunity as its original Ability but not its current Ability, it will remain poisoned when switched out.
If the Pokmon with this Ability is poisoned and is holding a Pecha, Lum, or Drash Berry, Immunity will cure the Pokmon of poison before the Berry has a chance to be consumed.
When a poisoned Pokmon with Immunity enters battle, it will be cured of poison.

If a poisoned Pokmon has Immunity as its original Ability but not its current Ability, if it is one of the active Pokmon at the end of the battle or switched out, it will be cured of poison (with no message).
If a poisoned Pokmon has Immunity as its original Ability but not its current Ability, it will remain poisoned when switched out.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: If the Pokmon with this Ability is poisoned and is holding a Pecha or Lum Berry, the Berry will be eaten and cure the Pokmon of poison before Immunity has a chance to activate.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: A Pokmon with Immunity can be poisoned by Sunsteel Strike if the attacker has Poison Touch, but will be cured of poison immediately.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: As soon as the user comes into battle, it transforms into its opponent. Imposter copies the target's appearance, cry, moves (which all have 5 PP), Ability, stats (except HP), stat changes (but not stat multipliers such as with Choice Specs), weight, and Mega Evolution or form (regardless of held item). Imposter does not copy its opponent's IVs (for the purpose of Hidden Power), friendship or gender.

Imposter will not activate if the opponent is transformed, disguised with Illusion, or behind a substitute. Imposter only activates when the Pokmon with the Ability is sent out; if it fails to transform into an opponent, it will not activate unless the Pokmon with Imposter is withdrawn and sent out again. Imposter will also not activate when obtained during battle.

In Double Battles, Triple Battles, and Battle Royals, Imposter will copy the opponent in the position directly opposite it. If there is no opponent directly opposite it, it will not transform. In Horde Encounters, Imposter will copy the opponent in the right-most position.

A transformed Pokmon can use moves exclusive to a species it has transformed into, such as Hyperspace Fury if transformed into Hoopa Unbound. A transformed Pokmon can use Z-Moves exclusive to a species it has transformed into, if it holds an appropriate Z-Crystal. If the Pokmon with this Ability has transformed into a Mega-Evolved Pokmon, it cannot use any Z-Moves, even if it holds an appropriate Z-Crystal.
Role Play fails if the target has the Ability Imposter. Entrainment fails if the user has the Ability Imposter. Imposter cannot be copied by Trace, Power of Alchemy, or Receiver.
Even if a Pokmon transforms into Meteor Form Minior, Shields Down will not prevent a transformed Pokmon from being afflicted with status conditions.

If the Pokmon with this Ability transforms into a Pokmon that has no type (i.e. it was a pure Fire type that used Burn Up), the transformed Pokmon will become Normal-type; if such a Pokmon has additionally been affected by Forest's Curse or Trick-or-Treat, the user will become Normal-type with an added Grass or Ghost type respectively. If the Pokmon with this Ability transforms into a dual-typed Pokmon that has used Burn Up, however, Imposter will copy the user's current types (and type additions) as usual.

If a Pokmon transforms into a Dynamax Pokmon, it will successfully transform but not become Dynamaxed. Transformed Pokmon can Dynamax, unless they are transformed into Zacian, Zamazenta, or Eternatus. Transform does not copy the Gigantamax Factor, so even if a Pokmon transforms into a Pokmon that can Gigantamax, the transformed Pokmon will be able to Dynamax but not Gigantamax. If the target is Eternamax Eternatus, the user transforms into the regular version of Eternatus.
Moves used by a Pokmon with Infiltrator bypass the effects of targets' Reflect, Light Screen, Safeguard, and Mist.
Moves used by a Pokmon with Infiltrator also bypass the effects of targets' Aurora Veil.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Moves used by a Pokmon with Infiltrator, except Transform and Sky Drop, also bypass the effects of targets' substitutes.
Description.Game: X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: When a Pokmon with this Ability is knocked out by an opponent's attack, it deals damage to that opponent equal to the amount of HP it had left before last being hit.
If a Pokmon with this Ability faints through Future Sight or Doom Desire, Innards Out will only activate if the user of the move is still on the field.
If a Pokmon with this Ability moves first and is then knocked out by Core Enforcer, Innards Out will not activate.
If Innards Out causes two opposing Pokmon to faint at the same time, and neither party has any remaining Pokmon, then the Pokmon that activated Innards Out loses.
Inner Focus prevents the Pokmon from flinching. However, Pokmon with this Ability can still flinch to a Pokmon with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze.
While some descriptions state that the user flinches, Focus Punch failing due to taking damage is not flinching, so the move is unaffected by Inner Focus.
If the Pokmon is hit by a move that always causes flinching, the message "<Pokmon>'s Inner Focus prevents flinching!" will appear.
If the Pokmon is hit by a move that always causes flinching, the message "<Pokmon> won't flinch because of its Inner Focus!" will appear.
Inner Focus now also blocks Intimidate.
Insomnia prevents the Pokmon from being afflicted by sleep and Yawn. Rest will fail when used by the Pokmon.

A Pokmon with this Ability will wake up if it is asleep in battle (such as if it gains the Ability outside of battle or by an effect like Skill Swap, or is put to sleep by a Pokmon with an Ability like Mold Breaker).
If a Pokmon with this Ability is drowsy due to Yawn, when it would fall asleep the Ability activates and keeps it awake.
The move Worry Seed can change the target Pokmon's Ability to Insomnia.

If a sleeping Pokmon with Insomnia is sent into battle as one of the lead Pokmon or to replace a fainted Pokmon, or gains Insomnia due to Trace, it will not be cured of sleep until after a Pokmon takes its turn (uses a move, switches out, etc.). It will be cured of sleep if it is switched in to replace a switched out Pokmon (including if switched in via Baton Pass).
If a sleeping Pokmon has Insomnia as its original Ability but not its current Ability, it will remain asleep when switched out.
If the Pokmon with this Ability is asleep and is holding a Chesto or Lum Berry, Insomnia will cure the Pokmon of sleep before the Berry has a chance to be consumed.
There is no known way for a sleeping Pokmon with Insomnia to enter battle.

If a sleeping Pokmon has Insomnia as its original Ability but not its current Ability, if it is one of the active Pokmon at the end of the battle or switched out, it will be cured of sleep (with no message).
When a sleeping Pokmon with Insomnia enters battle, it will be cured of sleep.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: If a sleeping Pokmon has Insomnia as its original Ability but not its current Ability, it will remain asleep when switched out.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: If the Pokmon with this Ability is asleep and is holding a Chesto or Lum Berry, the Berry will be eaten and cure the Pokmon of sleep before Insomnia has a chance to activate.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: When a Pokmon with Intimidate enters the battle, it lowers the Attack stat of all adjacent opponents by one stage.
Intimidate's activation message reads "<Pokmon>'s Intimidate cuts <opponent>'s attack!"
Intimidate has no effect on Pokmon who are immune to Attack stat reductions, such as Pokmon with Clear Body, Hyper Cutter, or White Smoke. This Ability will not affect a target with a substitute.
Intimidate now also activates when a Pokmon gains the Ability, such as via Skill Swap or Mega Evolution.
Intimidate's activation message reads "<Opponent>'s Attack fell!"
In a Triple Battle, Intimidate does not affect non-adjacent Pokmon.
Intimidate does not affect Pokmon with the Full Metal Body Ability.
Wild Pokmon are more likely to call for help when facing a Pokmon with Intimidate. It shares this effect with Pressure and Unnerve.
If a Pokmon holding an Adrenaline Orb is affected by Intimidate, the item will be consumed and increase the holder's Speed by one stage.
Intimidate does not affect Pokmon with Inner Focus, Oblivious, Scrappy, or Own Tempo. Intimidate also now triggers Rattled.
Intrepid Sword raises the Attack stat of the Pokmon with this Ability by one stage when it enters the battle.

When a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacking Pokmon takes damage equal to 1/8 of its own maximum HP. If Iron Barbs causes both the Pokmon with this Ability and the attacking Pokmon to faint, then the attacking Pokmon will faint first.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is hit by a multi-strike move that makes contact (such as Fury Swipes), each hit will activate this Ability.
Iron Fist causes the power of affected punching moves to increase by 20%.

When a Pokmon with Justified is hit by a Dark-type damaging move, its Attack is increased by one stage. This ability does not provide immunity or reduction to the damage, nor does it activate from a Dark-type move hitting its Substitute. Dark-type multi-strike moves (such as Beat Up) will activate Justified once per strike, increasing the Attack stat that many stages.
Keen Eye prevents other Pokmon from lowering the accuracy stat stage of the Pokmon with this Ability.
Effects that decrease accuracy without using stat stages, such as Wonder Skin and Sand Veil, are unaffected by Keen Eye.
This Ability can be ignored with Mold Breaker, Teravolt, and Turboblaze.
Keen Eye now also ignores the target's evasion stages.
Klutz prevents the effects of the held item of the Pokmon with this Ability from applying.
Klutz does not negate item effects that affect prize money, experience, effort values, or friendship, such as those of the Amulet Coin, Lucky Egg, Power Weight, or Soothe Bell.
The Speed drop from the Iron Ball, Macho Brace, and Power items (such as the Power Bracer) is not negated by Klutz. However, the grounding effect of the Iron Ball is negated.

Klutz prevents the Pokmon with this Ability from using Natural Gift; however, it does not prevent the Pokmon from using Fling. If a Pokmon with Klutz uses Bug Bite or Pluck, it will consume the target's held Berry without gaining its effects. If a Pokmon with Klutz uses Judgment, it will be a Normal-type move.

Klutz now prevents the Pokmon with this Ability from using Fling. If a Pokmon with Klutz uses Bug Bite or Pluck, it will now receive the effects of a consumed held Berry. If a Pokmon with Klutz uses Techno Blast or Multi-Attack, it will be a Normal-type move. Pokmon with this Ability are not affected by Poltergeist.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: All effects of the Iron Ball are now negated by Klutz. However, Klutz still does not negate the Speed drop from the Macho Brace and Power items. Klutz cannot negate form-changing effects of items, but will still negate the other effects of those items (e.g. if a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb has Klutz, it will remain in its Origin Forme, but will not receive the 20% boost in the power of Dragon- and Ghost-type moves).
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: If a Pokmon is already locked into a move due to a held Choice item (Choice Scarf, Choice Specs, Choice Band), if the held Choice item is removed while its effect is negated, the Pokmon will be affected by the Choice item lock glitch.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Klutz does not prevent Pokmon with this Ability from Mega Evolving with a Mega Stone, undergoing Primal Reversion with the Red Orb or Blue Orb, or using a Z-Move with a Z-Crystal.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: During harsh sunlight, Leaf Guard prevents the Pokmon from being afflicted by non-volatile status conditions and Yawn (including via the Flame Orb and Toxic Orb). It has no effect on any current status condition prior to the weather being set up.
If a Pokmon with this Ability is drowsy due to Yawn, if there is harsh sunlight when it would fall asleep, the Ability activates and keeps it awake.
Leaf Guard does not prevent self-inflicted sleep from Rest.
Leaf Guard now prevents the use of Rest.
Description.Game: Black,White,Black 2,White 2,X,Y,Omega Ruby,Alpha Sapphire,Sun,Moon,Ultra Sun,Ultra Moon,Sword,Shield,Brilliant Diamond,Shining Pearl,Legend Arceus

Description.Description: Levitate renders the Pokmon with this Ability immune to damaging Ground-type moves (except Thousand Arrows). It also is unaffected by the effects of Arena Trap, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, Rototiller, and terrain. Additionally, Poison-type Pokmon with Levitate do not remove Toxic Spikes upon switching in.
These immunities are lost during Gravity or if the Pokmon with Levitate is holding an Iron Ball, is under the effects of Ingrain, or has been hit by Smack Down or Thousand Arrows.
